comments.body: If you add a JAR file as a 'file', it won't be on the classpath right? So I'm not sure if this is a usual usage to show. You'd normally `ADD JAR` right?
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -19,4 +19,32 @@ license: | limitations under the License. --- -**This page is under construction** +### Description +`ADD FILE` adds a file, JAR or archive to the list of resources. The added file can be listed using [LIST FILE](sql-ref-syntax-aux-resource-mgmt-list-file.html). + +### Syntax +{% highlight sql %} +ADD FILE file_name +{% endhighlight %} + +### Parameters +
+
file_name
+
The name of the file, JAR or archive to be added.
+
+ +### Examples +{% highlight sql %} + add FILE /tmp/test1.jar;

comments.body:
Right. Adding a JAR file as a 'file' won't be on the classpath. 
I will modify the PR to make it only show ```add JAR``` for JARs and ```add FILE``` for files. Thanks!
